org.openbel.framework.common.index
Enum ResourceIndex

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<ResourceIndex>
      org.openbel.framework.common.index.ResourceIndex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<ResourceIndex>
public enum ResourceIndex
extends Enum<ResourceIndex>

ResourceIndex defines a singleton instance to hold an Index.

An Index must first be loaded by calling #loadIndex(Index) before trying to access it. Accessing an index before it has been loaded or trying to load a subsequent index will trigger a IllegalStateException.

Author:
Anthony Bargnesi <abargnesi@selventa.com>

loadIndex

public void loadIndex()
Loads a default Index with empty resources.

See loadIndex(File) in order to load the Index from an index file.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - Thrown if the index has already been loaded

loadIndex

public void loadIndex(File indexFile)
               throws FileNotFoundException,
                      XMLStreamException
Loads the Index instance once.

Subsequent attempts to load an index will trigger an IllegalStateException.

Parameters:
indexFile - File, the index xml file to load which cannot be null
Throws:
XMLStreamException - Thrown if there was an xml processing error when parsing the index file
FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the indexFile File resource could not be found for reading
IllegalStateException - Thrown if the index has already been loaded
InvalidArgument - Thrown if the indexFile to load the index from is null.

getIndex

public Index getIndex()
Returns the loaded Index.

If the index has not be loaded then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Returns:
Index the loaded index
Throws:
IllegalStateException - Thrown if the index has not been loaded by calling loadIndex(File)

isLoaded

public boolean isLoaded()
Determines if the Index has been loaded.

Returns:
the load status of Index
